alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Kerr; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 12 at 9:07PM CDT until May 12 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin San Antonio has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Medina County in south central Texas... Bandera County in south central Texas... Northwestern Kerr County in south central Texas... Uvalde County in south central Texas... Northern Zavala County in south central Texas... Real County in south central Texas... * Until 1000 PM CDT. * At 907 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles west of Kerr Wildlife Management Area to near Utopia to 7 miles southeast of Uvalde Estates, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Medina, Uvalde, Leakey, Vanderpool, Tarpley, Sabinal, Hunt, Laguna, D`Hanis, Tuff, Concan, Kerr Wildlife Management Area, Uvalde Estates, Dabney, Cline, Reagan Wells, Utopia, Knippa, Blewett and Rio Frio. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging winds, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bandera; Kerr; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Zavala
